FleetRL.utils.observation package

Submodules

FleetRL.utils.observation.observer module

class FleetRL.utils.observation.observer.Observer[source]

Bases: object

static flatten_obs(obs)[source]
get_obs(db: DataFrame, price_lookahead: int, bl_pv_lookahead: int, time: Timestamp, ev_conf: EvConfig, load_calc: LoadCalculation, aux: bool, target_soc: list) → dict[source]
Parameters:

  • db – database from the env

  • price_lookahead – lookahead window for spot price

  • bl_pv_lookahead – lookahead window for building load and pv

  • time – current time of time step

  • ev_conf – EV config needed for batt capacity and other params

  • load_calc – Load calc module needed for grid connection and other params

  • aux – Include auxiliary information that might help the agent to learn the problem

  • target_soc – A list of target soc values, one for each car

Returns:

Returns a list of np arrays that make up different parts of the observation.

static get_trip_len(db: DataFrame, car: int, time: Timestamp) → float[source]
Parameters:

  • db – from the env

  • car – car ID

  • time – current timestamp

Returns:

length of trip in hours as a float

FleetRL.utils.observation.observer_bl_pv module

class FleetRL.utils.observation.observer_bl_pv.ObserverWithBoth[source]

Bases: Observer

get_obs(db: DataFrame, price_lookahead: int, bl_pv_lookahead: int, time: Timestamp, ev_conf: EvConfig, load_calc: LoadCalculation, aux: bool, target_soc: list) → dict[source]
Parameters:

  • db – Database from env

  • price_lookahead – Lookahead in hours for price

  • bl_pv_lookahead – Lookahead in hours for PV and building

  • time – Current time

  • ev_conf – EV config data, used for battery capacity, etc.

  • load_calc – Load calc module, used for grid connection, etc.

  • aux – Flag to include extra information on the problem or not. Can help with training

  • target_soc – List for the current target SOC of each car

Returns:

Dict of lists with different parts of the observation

# define the starting and ending time via lookahead, np.where returns the index in the dataframe # add lookahead + 2 here because of rounding issues with the resample function on square times (00:00) # get data of price and date from the specific indices # resample data to only include one value per hour (the others are duplicates) # only take into account the current value, and the specified hours of lookahead

static get_trip_len(db: DataFrame, car: int, time: Timestamp) → float[source]
Parameters:

  • db – from the env

  • car – car ID

  • time – current timestamp

Returns:

length of trip in hours as a float

Dict of lists with different parts of the observation

# define the starting and ending time via lookahead, np.where returns the index in the dataframe # add lookahead + 2 here because of rounding issues with the resample function on square times (00:00) # get data of price and date from the specific indices # resample data to only include one value per hour (the others are duplicates) # only take into account the current value, and the specified hours of lookahead
